I've been using scilab like forever, it has gone through many major improvements and is very good to my opinion. the ponly problem that i might have with it is that it really has no symbolic powers whatsoever - but it offers interfaces to many other apps which can do that for you if you really need it

don't get me wrong but I think if you know your arsenal the open software realm offers you more tools in sum than matlab and maple do together. you will have to pick them manually but alltogether if you know the right packages open can do anything that propritary can (unless you have really VERY specific needs)
besides if you are familar with matlab scilab is pretty close and, if im not wrong about matlab, is far ahead of the latter for the many interfaces it has

if the choice was between open source only or proprietary stuff only I would go open source all the way.. but if I have to chose from open source or (open source and proprietary) the later has more features etc etc..
